q: If I won $1M, first thing I'd buy:
D: Your love... oh wait, I already have that

q: On a free day I'd rather:
D: Pretend I'm productive while binge-watching Netflix

q: My ideal date night is:
D: Arguing about what to watch for 2 hours

q: If we had a pet, it would be:
D: A plant (I can barely keep us alive)

q: My biggest fear about our relationship:
D: You discovering my true Netflix viewing habits

q: For our anniversary I'd prefer:
D: Anything that doesn't involve me planning it

q: If we moved in together, I'd want:
C: To move in with family temporarily
D: Separate bathrooms so you never see me human

q: My biggest relationship weakness is:
D: My ability to eat entire pizzas alone

q: When we fight, I usually:
A: Want to talk it out immediately
D: Bring up that thing you did three years ago

q: My love language is:
D: You doing the dishes without being asked

q: If I could change one thing about you:
D: Your ability to find anything I've lost

q: My ideal vacation with you is:
D: Anywhere with room service and no pants required

q: When I'm stressed, I need:
D: Wine and the ability to complain for exactly 47 minutes

q: My biggest insecurity in relationships:
D: My cooking skills (or lack thereof)

q: If we broke up, I'd:
D: Change all my passwords immediately

q: My family's opinion of you matters:
D: Only if they're paying for dinner

q: I show love best through:
D: Sharing my food with you

q: When you're sick, I:
B: Give you space but check in
D: Assume you're being dramatic but bring soup anyway

q: My biggest relationship dealbreaker:
D: Not laughing at my jokes

q: If I had to pick your best quality:
D: Your ability to reach high shelves

q: Our biggest relationship challenge is:
D: Deciding what to watch on Netflix

q: I prefer to resolve conflict by:
D: Passive-aggressive Post-it notes

q: My biggest fear about marriage:
D: Having to share a closet

q: If we had kids, I'd want:
D: To practice on a houseplant first

q: When making decisions together, I:
D: Pretend to have opinions about things I don't care about

q: My ideal way to spend a Sunday:
D: In bed until it's technically Monday

q: I need reassurance about:
D: Whether that text sounded weird

q: My favorite way to show affection:
D: Letting you control the remote

q: If money wasn't an issue, I'd:
D: Finally try that expensive restaurant without checking prices

q: When I'm angry, I:
D: Passive-aggressively reorganize your stuff

q: My biggest worry about our future:
D: Running out of shows to binge together

q: I handle jealousy by:
D: Stalking their social media at 2 AM

q: My ideal engagement would be:
D: Anywhere but a sporting event jumbotron

q: When we disagree, I:
D: Bring up receipts from previous arguments

q: My favorite thing about our relationship:
C: How we make each other laugh
D: You laugh at my dad jokes

q: I prefer to celebrate milestones:
D: By posting about it on social media

q: My biggest relationship strength is:
D: My ability to remember what you like on your pizza

q: If we're running late, I:
C: Blame you for not being ready
D: Suggest we just skip it and order takeout

q: I want to grow old together by:
D: Competing to see who complains about their back more

q: When planning our future, I think about:
D: Whether we'll still find each other attractive

q: My approach to social media in relationships:
A: Share some things but keep it private
D: Use couple photos to make my ex jealous

q: If I could plan the perfect surprise for you:
D: I'd actually remember what you mentioned wanting

q: When you're upset with me, I:
B: Give you space to cool down
C: Try to understand what I did wrong
D: Panic and start making your favorite food

q: My idea of couple time is:
D: Sitting in comfortable silence while scrolling phones

q: I prefer to handle money in relationships:
D: Let you handle it while I provide commentary

q: My biggest hope for us:
D: That you never discover my true pizza consumption levels

q: When I need emotional support, I:
D: Eat my feelings and then talk

q: If we lived together, I'd be responsible for:
D: Providing running commentary on reality TV

q: My favorite memory of us is:
D: When you finally laughed at my terrible joke

q: I show I'm ready for commitment by:
D: Letting you see me without makeup/before coffee

q: When we're apart, I:
C: Count down until I see you
D: Wonder what you're doing every 15 minutes

q: My biggest relationship goal is:
D: Successfully assembling IKEA furniture without fighting

q: I prefer to express disagreement by:
D: Subtle hints you'll never pick up on

q: My ideal wedding would be:
D: Eloping to avoid the stress

q: When planning dates, I prefer:
D: Mutual agreement that Netflix counts as a date

q: My response to relationship advice from others:
A: Listen but make my own decisions
D: Nod politely while ignoring completely

q: If I had to describe our chemistry:
D: Like a science experiment that somehow worked

q: My biggest compromise in relationships:
D: Pretending to like your favorite music

q: When meeting your friends, I:
A: Want to make a good impression
D: Wonder which ones have the best stories about you

q: My approach to anniversaries:
D: Put reminders in my phone because I will forget

q: If we had different political views:
D: I'd pretend to care about politics

q: My favorite way to relax together:
D: Judging other couples on reality TV

q: When it comes to PDA, I prefer:
D: Holding hands so you can't escape

q: My biggest relationship pet peeve:
D: You leaving your dishes in the sink

q: If we went to couples therapy:
C: I'd prefer to work things out ourselves
D: I'd prepare my list of your issues in advance

q: My definition of a perfect relationship:
D: Someone who gets all my references

q: When we have different opinions on something important:
A: We discuss until we understand each other
C: One of us usually gives in
D: We flip a coin like mature adults

q: My approach to your ex-partners:
A: Part of your past, no concern
D: Will definitely compare myself to them

q: If I could change one thing about relationships in general:
D: Telepathic abilities to know what you want for dinner

q: My biggest fear about long-term commitment:
D: Running out of conversation topics

q: When it comes to sharing household chores:
D: Ignore them until one of us breaks

q: My ideal way to spend Valentine's Day:
D: Avoiding the commercial madness entirely

q: If we disagreed about having kids:
A: We'd need to work it out
D: We'd start with a pet and see how that goes

q: My favorite quality in a long-term partner:
D: Ability to find things I've lost

q: When planning our future together, I focus on:
D: Making sure we'll still like each other

q: My approach to relationship social media:
D: Use it to prove we're happy to everyone else

q: If I had to pick our strongest connection:
D: Shared appreciation for pizza at any hour

q: My biggest hope for how we'll communicate:
A: Always be honest with each other
B: Learn to read each other's moods
D: Develop telepathic powers for dinner decisions

q: In this lifetime and the next, I would:
D: Remember to write down your coffee order
